item.title: Create Constraints
item.description:
This section describes how to create a constraint.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

  • A constraint template has been created.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraints in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Create on the page.

  4. In the Create Constraint dialog, set the following parameters, then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Constraint Name

item.title: View Constraint List
item.description:
This section describes how to view the constraint list.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraints in the left navigation pane.

    • The constraint list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: View Constraint Details
item.description:
This section describes how to view constraint details.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraints in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click the name of a constraint in the constraint list to open its details page.

  4. In the Attributes area on the left side of the constraint details page, view the basic information of the constraint.

    Parameter Description

    Cluster

    The cluster to which the constraint belongs.

    Creation Time

    The creation time of the constraint.

item.title: Edit Constraint Configuration
item.description:
This section describes how to edit constraint configuration.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraints in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right side of the constraint you want to edit, then select Edit YAML from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Edit YAML dialog, modify the configuration, then click OK.

item.title: Delete Constraints
item.description:
This section describes how to delete a constraint.

Warning

Constraints cannot be recovered after deletion. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraints in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right side of the constraint you want to delete, then select Delete from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Delete Constraints dialog, enter the name of the constraint, then click OK.
